## Python

::: software
Pypillometry <https://github.io/ihrke/pypillometry> ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ihrke/pypillometry/master/logo/pypillometry_logo_200x200.png?token=AAIWMEINEM6MUOAPT2NV4I252K5QW){.alignright width=120px}
: The `pypillometry` package implements functions for the analysis of pupillometric data. Features include preprocessing, blink handling, event-related pupil-dilation, plotting and signal modeling. [Homepage](http://ihrke.github.io/pypillometry) | [GitHub](https://github.com/ihrke/pypillometry) | [Paper](https://joss.theoj.org/papers/10.21105/joss.02348)
:::

::: software
Pyrace <https://github.com/ihrke/pyrace> ![](/pics/pyrace.png){.alignright width=120px}
: Race-models in Python. Currently focus on Stop-Signal-Tasks but supports generic accumulators and experimental designs.
:::


::: software
LibEEGTools <https://github.com/ihrke/libeegtools> ![](/pics/libeegtools.png){.alignright width=120px}
: A C-library for processing EEG-data with minimal requirements. Implements filtering (bandpass, wavelets, ...), dynamic time warping, clustering, time-frequency analysis, recurrence plots etc. Comes with a basic Python interface. [Documentation](https://libeegtools.sourceforge.net/api/current/index.html) | [GitHub](https://github.com/ihrke/libeegtools)
:::

::: software
Nipype-connect-str <https://github.com/ihrke/nipype_connect_str>
: tiny grammar for [NiPype](https://nipype.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) to allow for a nicer connection string of nodes in workflow
:::

## Web-apps

::: software
Balancinator <https://github.com/ihrke/balancinator> ![](/pics/balancinator.png){.alignright width=120px}
: The Balancinator is a free and open-source software to visualize distribution of men and women within a specific unit. The Balancinator allows anyone to build generic plots by inserting simple excel sheets instead of writing programming code. [WebApp](https://shiny.uit.no/balancinator/) | [GitHub](https://github.com/ihrke/balancinator)
:::

::: software
Balancinator-HE <https://github.com/ihrke/norgeibalanse> ![](/pics/balancinator_he.png){.alignright width=120px}
: The Balancinator|HE is a free and open-source dashboard to visualize distribution of men and women within higher education in Norway. [WebApp](https://shiny.uit.no/norgeibalanse/) | [GitHub](https://github.com/ihrke/norgeibalanse)
:::

## Markdown

I rely on [pandoc](https://pandoc.org/) and a set of templates for writing everything from papers, letters and lectures.

::: software
markdown-paper <https://github.com/ihrke/markdown-paper> ![](https://github.com/ihrke/markdown-paper/raw/master/pics/paper_elife.png){.alignright width=120px}
: a setup for writing scientific papers in markdown; supports different styles for various scientific journals (I add new ones when I submit a paper to a new journal), references through bibtex
:::

::: software
markdown-talk <https://github.com/ihrke/markdown-talk> ![](/pics/markdown-talk){.alignright width=120px}
: my setup for producing beamer-based slides for lectures and talks (PDF)
:::

::: software
markdown-letter <https://github.com/ihrke/markdown-letter> ![](/pics/markdown-letter){.alignright width=120px}
: writing latex-based letters with markdown; includes a template for my [UiT](https://uit.no)'s letter head
:::
